ospsuite.parameteridentification 1.2.0
  • Reference

PIOutputMapping

Source: R/PIOutputMapping.R
PIOutputMapping.Rd

An object that combines simulation output with observed data. The parameter identification minimizes the distance between the simulation output and the observed data.

Super class

ospsuite.utils::Printable -> PIOutputMapping

Active bindings

observedXYData

Named list with the XYData that will be compared with simulation results. Names are the labels of the xySeries objects

quantity

Simulation quantity which results are to be compared to observed data. Read-only.

transformResultsFunction

Function that will be applied to simulated results. Allows to manipulate simulated values before calculating the residuals. The function should manipulate numeric vectors 'xVals' and 'yVals' (that being the simulated time- and observation values) that will be than assigned to the x- and y-values of the simulated result. The function must return a named list with key 'xVals' and 'yVals'.

Inherited methods

    Method new()

    Initialize a new instance of the class

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$new(quantity)

    Arguments

    quantity

    An object of the type Quantity

    Returns

    A new PIOutputMapping object. Add observed data as XYData object(s).

    Method addObservedData()

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$addObservedData(XYData)

    Arguments

    XYData

    Object or a list of objects of the type XYData. Each data set must be of the same dimension as the simulation quantity of the mapping.

    Details

    If an observed data object with the same label already exists, it will be overwritten.

    Method removeXYSeries()

    Remove the observed data.

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$removeXYSeries(label)

    Arguments

    label

    label of the x-y values series to be removed

    Method setXFactors()

    Set the X-factors of x-y values by labels.

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$setXFactors(labels, xFactors)

    Arguments

    labels

    A list of label of XYData

    xFactors

    Numeric values that will be multiplied by the x-values

    Method setYFactors()

    Set the y-factors of x-y values by labels.

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$setYFactors(labels, yFactors)

    Arguments

    labels

    A list of label of XYData

    yFactors

    Numeric values that will be multiplied by the y-values

    Method setXOffset()

    Set the X-offset of x-y values by labels.

    Usage

    PIOutputMapping$setXOffset(labels, xOffset)

    Arguments

    labels

    A list of label of XYData

    xOffset

    Numeric values that will be added to the x-values

    Print the object to the console

    Usage

    Arguments

    Whether to make a deep clone.
